explains: v. 使安静，使昏昏欲睡；使（人）放松警惕，哄骗；（使）减弱，平息，停止
n. 间歇，暂时平静；低谷期

sentences.en: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.cn: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

sentences.en: Most probably, the lull is due to the summer holidays.
sentences.cn: 不过，现在的间歇很可能是正放暑假的缘故。

sentences.en: So how likely is Toyota to repeat Audi's 15-year lull?
sentences.cn: 那么，丰田有多大的可能性重复奥迪15年的恢复？
